q_en: What is the progress of sewing tasks for William?
gt:
Hello there! üòÑ Let's take a look at the progress of sewing tasks for our customer, William. Based on the data, here's what we have:

| Order ID | Total Products | Total Completed | Progress |
|----------|----------------|-----------------|----------|
| 8        | 585            | 585             | 100%     |

William's sewing tasks are fully completed! üéâ Everything is on track and finished. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòä

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'William';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "William"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '8';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for the customer "William"

steps.sql: SELECT id, number FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (8);
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs and the number of required products for each order of the customer "William"

steps.sql: SELECT order_product_id, SUM(completed_number) as total_completed FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (28, 29, 30) GROUP BY order_product_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total completed number of sewing tasks for each order_product ID

steps.sql: SELECT op.order_id, SUM(st.total_completed) / SUM(op.number) as progress FROM (SELECT order_product_id, SUM(completed_number) as total_completed FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (28, 29, 30) GROUP BY order_product_id) st JOIN order_product op ON st.order_product_id = op.id GROUP BY op.order_id;
steps.description: Calculate the progress of sewing tasks for each order by dividing the total completed number by the total number of products
